question: The drug which causes renal papillary necrosis is?
exp: Ans. (a) Acetophenetidin. Ref: Robbiris pathology 9th ed. /423. 936t* Renal papillary necrosis due to acetophenetidin/ phenacetin is a gradual process with slow loss of renal function.* The most common cause of renal papillary necrosis is diabetic glomerulopathy
